results.title: St. Elmo's fire
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: This 80s Brat Pack film from Joel Schmacher depicts the ups and downs of life for a group of young college graduate friends who are looking for something beyond their diplomas. Leslie and Alex live together and argue over when to get married. Meanwhile, Kevin is secretly in love with Leslie as he passes his time writing obituaries for the newspaper. Wendy works for the welfare department and is in love with Billy, though her rich parents want her married and running the family franchise. Billy keeps living life like he just graduated, and is trying to stay faithful and sober enough to get back with his wife and baby. Jules experiences crisis after crisis as she spirals into debt, taking drugs, drinking and partying. Kirby is obsessed with an old flame. Cast includes: Rob Lowe, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Judd Nelson, Ally Sheedy, Emilio Estevez and Andie MacDowell.

results.title: St. Albans: an ethnic programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre and Ian Hart
results.brief_description: St Albans is a multilingual, multicultural community where 85% of the population are migrants from non-English speaking countries. St Albans East primary school, with a schools commission grant, employ parents in a program to increase the children’s awareness of community languages and culture.

results.title: St Paul's Cathedral
results.creator_credit: Merton Park and James E. Rogers
results.brief_description: A survey of London’s most famous cathedral, in itself a monument to Sir Christopher Wren. Its nave, central dome, whispering gallery, choir and high altar enshringe memorials to Nelson, Wellington, Gordon, Kitchener, and other famous men of the British Isles. Narrated by Robert Speaight,

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Christopher Mylne
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.

results.title: St Barbe of the trees
results.creator_credit: M B Oldfield and Sons and Barrie Oldfield
results.brief_description: Presents 92 year-old Richard St Barbe Baker, the man who founded the international movement “Men of the Trees” in 1922, talking about trees: their life-giving qualities, the threats to them from disease and overfelling; and the need to plant for our lives. The first half of the film is scientific in approach while the second half becomes more lyrical with St Barbe reciting his favourite tree poems.

results.title: Squirrel on my shoulder and Brockside
results.brief_description: Squirrel on my shoulder, narrated by Sir David Attenborough, tells the story of Sammy, an orphaned baby Grey Squirrel which was raised by a cat as one of her kittens, and eventually released back into the wild. “Brockside”, presented by Simon King, looks at the tenuous life of the urban Badger, living off its human neighbours as urban devlopment enchroaches on the lands they have traditionally occupied.
